content.rendered:
Over-the-counter (OTC) hearing aids are a new category of products that have been available directly to consumers without a prescription since October 2022. They are designed to enhance communication for adults 18 and over with perceived mild-to-moderate hearing loss, offering another pathway to get treated sooner. We hope the videos and other resources on this page help provide clarity and understanding for anyone with questions about this exciting new class of products.

HLAA HearingU OTC 101: Ask the Experts Webinar Series

The OTC 101: Ask the Experts Webinar Series was a series of four consumer-facing Q&A webinars presented by HLAA from fall 2023 through spring 2024, designed to share information about this new product category. A range of leading industry professionals—including regulators, researchers, audiologists and manufacturers—shared their expertise and answered questions about OTC hearing aids. 

All four webinars have been recorded and captioned for online viewing. Find the links and additional resources below. Please share this page with anyone you know who might be facing mild-to-moderate hearing loss.

Watch the HLAA OTC 101 Webinars:

OTC 101: Ask the Experts Webinar #4
Meet the Manufacturers, Part 2 
Sonova and Jabra Hearing, June 5, 2024

VIEW THE RECORDING

OTC 101: Ask the Experts Webinar #3
Meet the Manufacturers, Part 1 
Sony and EssilorLuxottica, May 22, 2024

VIEW THE RECORDING

OTC 101: Ask the Experts Webinar #2
How Can Over-the-Counter Hearing Aids Help?
AARP and NIDCD (NIH), February 20, 2024

VIEW THE RECORDING

OTC 101: Ask the Experts Webinar #1
Are Over-the-Counter Hearing Aids For You?
FDA Regulators, November 1, 2023 

VIEW THE RECORDING

 

OTC 101 was made possible by a grant from the Consumer Technology Association Foundation.

OTC Hearing Aid Resources

 

What’s Your Hearing Health Experience?

TAKE OUR OTC SURVEY

Could OTC Hearing Aids Help You?

Check our Tip Sheet First

Purchasing an OTC Hearing Aid?

Use HLAA’s Shopping Checklist

HLAA advocated for the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) OTC rule to include consumer protections:

    • Clearly-stated return policy
    • Package labeling on cellphone connectivity
    • More about FDA labels

FDA OTC HEARING AID GUIDE

Additional Resources
 

Online Hearing Evaluations
  • National Hearing Test
  • Online Hearing Tests Guide – National Council on Aging
  • Johns Hopkins: Your Hearing Number
  • Sony Online Screening Test
Third-Party OTC Hearing Aid Information and Reviews
  • Hearing Tracker 2024 OTC Best Hearing Aids
  • HearAdvisor 2023 OTC Hearing Aid Winners 
  • New York Times 2023 OTC Hearing Aid reviews

  • Hearing Industries Association (HIA) OTC Research

Hearing Loss Information from OTC 101 Webinar Panelists
  • NIDCD Online Guide to Adult Hearing Loss
  • AARP Hearing Center
  • AARP “Hearing Loss for Dummies” Book (for purchase)
  • Sony OTC Hearing Aids and Resources
  • Sonova: Sennheiser Hearing Aids and Resources
  • Jabra Enhance Hearing Aids and Resources

These resources are presented for information only and do not imply endorsement of any product by Hearing Loss Association of America.

OTC Hearing Aid Media Coverage

  • HLAA and OTC in the News 
  • HLAA One-Year OTC Anniversary Press Release (October 12, 2023)
  • HLAA Press Release on FDA OTC Ruling (August 16, 2022)
  • New York Times on OTC One-Year Anniversary
  • Forbes OTC Hearing Aids 12-Month Takeaways
